channel.title: Development of Computer Science
channel.description:
I have a presentation to create and I need more ideas to research as far as what topics I should discuss. So far this is what I have.
[pre][b]Companies[/b] Xerox First computer IBM DOS Apple Graphical User Interface (GUI) Steve Jobs Microsoft MS-DOS Bill Gates
[b]Operating Systems[/b] Windows Versions and differences MacOS Versions and differences Linux Versions and differences
[b]Computer Hardware Companies[/b] Dell HP Etc
[b]Microchip[/b] ideas?
[b]Computer parts[/b] Processor RAM Etc [b] Internet[/b] Development Website King (lol) -Need more idea More ideas
[b]Programming languages[/b] JAVA Ruby PHP HTML Simba [/pre]
Could anyone help me brainstorm off what I already have and possibly expand it? The presentation needs to be 10 minutes long.

item.title: Development of Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

t4:

Windows actually used to be a desktop environment for DOS up until Windows 2000.

Not really true, 9x was an OS in its own right, it kept DOS around as well, but it was far more than just a DE.

Read full topic

item.title: Development of Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:24, topic:395354”][quote author=t4 link=topic=492540.msg4061091#msg4061091 date=1343429654]
linux isn’t an os?..
[/quote]what? yeah and windows isn’t either it’s a piece of software so what’ your point.

and linux is just the name sort of like windows is the os’s are like cent0s, fedora, rhe, ubuntu, all that stuffs ikik try not to get smart.[/quote]
Uh, no. Linux is a kernel that is used in many OS’s such as CentOS, Ubuntu, and the like; similar to how NT is the kernel for all Windows OS’s after 2000. Windows actually used to be a desktop environment for DOS up until Windows 2000.

Read full topic

item.title: Development of Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

It honestly looks like you already have plenty of details to go over in ten minutes. I could give an hour presentation on just the Windows OS versions by itself…

But…

you could discuss the different Server’s, the new technologies that have come out for system administration over the years, the different types of networks(WLAN/LAN/VLAN etc ), you could discuss the different people who have changed the world of IT, you could discuss the propriety differences in buying IT services from companies and hiring your own staff, you could talk about how technology has affected you personally, you could help produce new options for IT.

Read full topic

item.description:
@vManlyMan wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:18, topic:395354”][quote author=ziplock link=topic=492540.msg4057461#msg4057461 date=1343105078]

Very simply, how the PC works. Should take up all your time you need to waste.

I don’t know how it is at where you live, but in most places you don’t get over one year to complete a presentation.

I said very simply.

No I don’t think you’re understanding that the OP was over a year ago.
[/quote]
Number 1, other ppl commented on it. Number 2, read my sig. I had this previously to you commenting and I’m not changing for you.[/quote]

Ok… but you’re giving advice to someone on presenting a project, for a class he completed a year ago. See what Bowser Jr, and Ziplock were saying now?

Read full topic

item.title: Development of Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:12, topic:395354”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=492540.msg3603510#msg3603510 date=1305849521]
Wat… Xerox - First computer?
[/quote]

Yea, what happened to people like Konrad Zuse?[/quote]

Well I knew ENIAC was the first computer but after researching it, I learned that the Xerox Alto was the first desktop computer that featured a keyboard, mouse, and GUI. I presented the project a few days ago with a better outline and some topics removed to save time. It lasted 15-17 minutes.

Read full topic
